list_definition.definition: a chance to do or a time for doing (something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: an opportunity to go to Rome
You’ve had several opportunities to ask him.

list_ex_of_english: We look forward to the opportunities thus granted to us.
But it could have been much more useful if the opportunity had been taken to prepare a new full edition.
What kinds of opportunities are there for developing symbolic competence?
Opportunity for increasing nitrogen use efficiency from improved lowland rice germplasm.
First, how do the opportunities for private gain differ in different electoral systems?
The cost of replacing carbon by growing trees is so high primarily because of the opportunity costs of foregoing agricultural production on prime cropland.
This makes for a clear and straightforward historical materialist account (drawing largely on previously published sources), but also leads to missed opportunities.
This restructuring provides the opportunity, as yet not fully achieved, of transferring resources between components of the healthcare system.
